snippet: A councilman proposed creating a system, similar to the one used by the White House, to facilitate making requests to city officials.
abstract: New York City lawmakers are considering local model of White House petition site that promises to respond to any request that receives enough signatures; online petition system would allow residents to directly ask anything they want of public officials and, with enough support, receive feedback; bill's sponsor, Councilman James Vacca, says it is 'way for people to register their views collectively.'
lead_paragraph: A councilman proposed creating a system, similar to the one used by the White House, to facilitate making requests to city officials.

headline.main: Online Petitions Proposed to Offer New Yorkers a New Way to Speak Out
headline.print_headline: Online Petitions Proposed to Offer New Yorkers a New Way to Speak Out

keywords.value: Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications (NYC)
keywords.name: organizations
